author: A_Brickset_user
title: best of all ambulances
review: - because there are two minfigs, a driver and a nurse, with the red-cross-pattern. the car has those nice window-panels, and they don't use the standardized stretcher, its assembled of usual parts. cool.

author: J_tje
title: Great Ambulance for the Town Medical Series
review:
This is a great set that goes so well with the one year earlier released Paramedic Unit (6364). Colour scheme is the same and there are some nice special parts (Wall elements).

A must have in the old school lego town!

author: Niki124
title: Well-designed and playable
review:
This was the first cab-and-panel vehicle we had in our Legoland collection, so it felt rather complicated to build at the time. Further experience of this type of vehicle showed that the ambulance's size mean it required more creativity in its design to accommodate the vehicle length. 

The colour and exterior design of the ambulance are striking, with an obviously recognisable red cross and realistic-looking shaded windows. The lights and sirens stand out well, in what would become a familiar configuration on Legoland Town vehicles. The stretcher is a neat addition - a simple build, yet easily recognisable and fun to play with.
